remarks: Inductive step for Ramsey's theorem, in the form of an explicit upper bound.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Apr-2015.)
statement:
ramub1.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN ) $.
ramub1.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. Fin ) $.
ramub1.f $e |- ( ph -> F : R --> NN ) $.
ramub1.g $e |- G = ( x e. R |-> ( M Ramsey ( y e. R |-> if ( y = x , ( ( F ` x ) - 1 ) , ( F ` y ) ) ) ) ) $.
ramub1.1 $e |- ( ph -> G : R --> NN0 ) $.
ramub1.2 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( M - 1 ) Ramsey G ) e. NN0 ) $.
ramub1 $p |- ( ph -> ( M Ramsey F ) <_ ( ( ( M - 1 ) Ramsey G ) + 1 ) ) $.
$d F x y $.
$d G x y $.
$d M x y $.
$d R x y $.
$d ph x y $.
